author: Staff Reporter
text:
Auspicious start:Holy flag being hoisted at Sri Periyanayaki Amman Temple in Palani to mark the commencement of Thai Poosam festival on Monday.— PHOTO: Special Arrangement

With hoisting of holy flag at Sri Periyanayaki Amman-Sri Somaskandhar Temple, popularly known as Oorkoil, the 10-day Thai Poosam festival began here on Monday.

Special pujas were performed to Lord Vinayagar and to the ‘kodimaram’ (flag mast) at Kodikatti Mandapam. Sixteen kinds of abishekams and special deeparadhana were performed to the presiding deities and to the flag mast. Later, Mayura and Vadhya pujas were also performed.

After the special pujas, idols of Lord Muthukumaraswamy and Goddess Valli and Goddess Deivanai were taken in a procession along the outer prakaram, and placed at Kodikatti Mandapam. A team of gurukkals, led by chief gurukkal Nataraja Pandithar, took the holy flag in a procession along the outer prakaram.

Amidst chanting of mantras and Thevaram hymns, the flag was hoisted between 9.30 a.m. and 10.30 a.m. in ‘Meena Lagnam’. Devotees in and around Palani witnessed the flag hoisting ceremony.

In the evening, the Lord and the Goddesses were taken in a procession along Rath streets in Pudhucherry Sapparam.

Thirukalyanam of Goddesses Valli and Deivanai with Lord Muthukumaraswamy will take place at 7.30 p.m. on January 23. The holy car procession will he held at 4.25 p.m. on January 24. The cracker festival is scheduled for January 25. The Poosam festival will conclude with the float festival on January 27.

The Utsavamurthy, along with the Goddesses will ascend various mounts and go around the Rath streets on all festival days.
title: Thai Poosam festival begins
